verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%>, even to <S%H3038>Jeduthun<s%>, A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%>. I <S%H559>said<s%>, I will take <S%H8104>heed<s%> to my <S%H1870>ways<s%>, that I <S%H2398>sin<s%> not with my <S%H3956>tongue<s%>: I will <S%H8104>keep<s%> my <S%H6310>mouth<s%> with a <S%H4269>bridle<s%>, while the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> is before me.
I was <S%H481>dumb<s%> with <S%H1747>silence<s%>, I held my <S%H2814>peace<s%>, even from <S%H2896>good<s%>; and my <S%H3511>sorrow<s%> was <S%H5916>stirred<s%>.

My <S%H3820>heart<s%> was <S%H2552>hot<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> me, while I was <S%H1901>musing<s%> the <S%H784>fire<s%> <S%H1197>burned<s%>: <S%H227>then<s%> <S%H1696>spake<s%> I with my <S%H3956>tongue<s%>,
<S%H3068>LORD<s%>, make me to <S%H3045>know<s%> mine <S%H7093>end<s%>, and the <S%H4060>measure<s%> of my <S%H3117>days<s%>, what it is; that I may <S%H3045>know<s%> how <S%H2310>frail<s%> I am.

Behold, thou hast <S%H5414>made<s%> my <S%H3117>days<s%> as an <S%H2947>handbreadth<s%>; and mine <S%H2465>age<s%> is as nothing before thee: verily <S%H3605>every<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> at his best <S%H5324>state<s%> is <S%H3605>altogether<s%> <S%H1892>vanity<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.

Surely every <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H1980>walketh<s%> in a vain <S%H6754>shew<s%>: surely they are <S%H1993>disquieted<s%> in <S%H1892>vain<s%>: he heapeth <S%H6651>up<s%> riches, and <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> not who shall <S%H622>gather<s%> them.
And now, <S%H136>Lord<s%>, what <S%H6960>wait<s%> I for? my <S%H8431>hope<s%> is in thee.
<S%H5337>Deliver<s%> me from all my <S%H6588>transgressions<s%>: <S%H7760>make<s%> me not the <S%H2781>reproach<s%> of the <S%H5036>foolish<s%>.
I was <S%H481>dumb<s%>, I <S%H6605>opened<s%> not my <S%H6310>mouth<s%>; because thou <S%H6213>didst<s%> it.
<S%H5493>Remove<s%> thy <S%H5061>stroke<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> from me: I am <S%H3615>consumed<s%> by the <S%H8409>blow<s%> of thine <S%H3027>hand<s%>.

When thou with <S%H8433>rebukes<s%> dost <S%H3256>correct<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> for <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>, thou makest his <S%H2530>beauty<s%> to consume <S%H4529>away<s%> like a <S%H6211>moth<s%>: surely every <S%H120>man<s%> is <S%H1892>vanity<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.

<S%H8085>Hear<s%> my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and give <S%H238>ear<s%> unto my <S%H7775>cry<s%>; hold not thy <S%H2790>peace<s%> at my <S%H1832>tears<s%>: for I am a <S%H1616>stranger<s%> with thee, and a <S%H8453>sojourner<s%>, as all my <S%H1>fathers<s%> were.
O <S%H8159>spare<s%> me, that I may recover <S%H1082>strength<s%>, before I go <S%H3212>hence<s%>, and be no more.
